meanings.definition: To adapt for a new use or purpose.
meanings.sent1: I will repurpose this old chair into a flower pot stand.
meanings.sent2: She decided to repurpose the glass jars as candle holders.
meanings.sent3: The children repurpose their toys in creative ways.
meanings.sent4: He managed to repurpose his old laptop into a makeshift server.
meanings.sent5: The artist repurposed scrap metal into a stunning sculpture.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the use or purpose of something.
meanings.sent1: The repurpose of the warehouse was to become a community center.
meanings.sent2: After the repurpose, the building served a completely different function.
meanings.sent3: The repurpose of the old factory surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The repurpose of the space transformed it into a cozy cafe.
meanings.sent5: The repurpose of the land turned it into a beautiful park.
